1.q_string:
A copper pipe of mass \(0.5 kg\) is originally at \(20^{\circ} C\). Its ends are capped after \(0.6 kg\) of water at \(80^{\circ} C\) is poured into it. What is the final temperature of the pipe? 

Assume no heat is lost to the surroundings. Specific heat of \(Cu =0.385 kJ kg ^{-1} K ^{-1}\).

A child has a high fever. The temperature of his body recorded by a thermometer is \(103^{\circ} F\). A doctor advises his mother to give medicine to lower the temperature. As we know, evaporation causes cooling. The medicine given to the child enhances the rate of evaporation. Calculate the rate of evaporation caused by the medicine if the temperature of the body of the child falls to \(99^{\circ} F\) in 25 minutes. (Given: Mass of child = \(20 kg ;\) specific heat of human body \(=4.2 J g ^{-1}{ }^{\circ} C ^{-1}\), and latent heat of vaporisation of water \(=2436 Jg ^{-1}\))

A steel rod \(50 m\) long and of cross-sectional area \(10 cm ^{2}\) is heated from \(0^{\circ} C\) to \(50^{\circ} C\). Calculate the increase in the length of the rod and the thermal or compressional stress, and the corresponding force which must be applied to avoid expansion if the ends of the rods are fixed between two rigid supports. (Given: \(\alpha=1.2 \times 10^{-5} {}^\circ C ^{-1}\) and \(Y =9.6 \times 10^{7} Nm ^{-2}\))

A sphere of steel has diameter \(5.70 cm\) at \(27^{\circ} C\). It is to be just inserted into a circular brass ring. If the diameter of the ring at \(27^{\circ} C\) is \(5.69 cm ,\) find the temperature at which the sphere just slides into the ring. (Given: \(\alpha_{\text {steel}}=1.1 \times 10^{-5}{ }^{\circ} C ^{-1}\) and \(\alpha_{\text {brass}}=1.9 \times 10^{-5} \textrm{ }^{\circ} C ^{-1}\))

A rail track made of steel having length \(10 m\) is clamped on a railway line at its two ends as shown in the figure. On a summer day, due to a rise in temperature by \(20^{\circ} C\), it is deformed as shown in the figure. Find \(x\) (displacement of the centre) if \(\alpha_{\text {steel}}=1.2 \times 10^{5 \circ} C ^{-1}\).

A drilling machine of \(5 kW\) is used to drill a hole in a block of copper of mass \(4.0 kg\). Calculate the rise in temperature of the block in \(5\; min\) if \(75 \%\) of the energy is used in heating the block. (Given: Specific heat of copper \(=0.385 Jg ^{-1}{ }^{\circ} C ^{-1}\))

A heavy box having a mass of \(300 kg\) is pulled along the floor for \(10 m\). If the coefficient of sliding friction is \(0.2\), then how much heat is produced? (Assume that work done in moving the box is converted into heat energy)
The volume of a block of metal changes by \(0.12 \%\) when it is heated through \(20^{\circ} C\). What is the coefficient of linear expansion of the heat?

A lead bullet strikes against a steel armour plate with the velocity of \(300 ms ^{-1} .\) If the bullet falls dead after the impact, find the rise in temperature of the bullet, assuming that the heat produced is shared equally between the bullet and the target. (Given: Specific heat of lead \(=0.03 cal g ^{-1}{ }^{\circ} C ^{-1}\))

A lead bullet just melts when stopped by an obstacle. Assuming that \(25 \%\) of the heat is absorbed by the obstacle, find the velocity of the bullet if its initial temperature is \(27^{\circ} C\). (Given: Melting point of lead = \(327^{\circ} C ,\) specific heat of lead \(=0.03\; cal\; g ^{-10} C ^{-1}\), latent heat of lead \(=\) \(0.03\; cal\; g ^{-1}{ }^{\circ} C ^{-1},\) latent heat of fusion of lead \(=6\; cal\; g ^{-1} ; 1 \;cal =4.2 J\))

A lead bullet at \(373 K\) strikes a steel plate and melts. What was its minimum speed? (Given: Specific heat of lead \(=0.03\; cal\;g^{-1} K ^{-1}\), latent heat \(=5 \times 10^{3}\;cal\;kg ^{-1}\) and melting point \(=600 K\). The heat produced is shared equally between the plate and the bullet)

A 50 g lead bullet (specific heat = 0.02) is initially at 30oC. It is fired vertically upwards with a speed of 840 ms–1. On returning to the starting level, it strikes a cake of ice at 0oC. How much ice is melted? Assume that all energy is spent in melting only and latent heat of ice = 336 J/g.
Find out the increase in moment of inertia I of a uniform rod (coefficient of linear expansion  =α) about its perpendicular bisector when its temperature is slightly increased by △T.

A pendulum clock made of iron rod keeps correct time at \( 20^\circ C\). How fast or slow will it go in \(24\) hours at \(40^{\circ} C\) ? (Given: Coefficient of linear expansion of iron \(=1.2 \times 10^{-5}{}^\circ C ^{-1}\))

A student eats a dinner rated \(2000\) calories. He wishes to do an equivalent amount of work in the gymnasium by lifting a \(50 kg\) mass. How many times must he raise the weight to expend this much energy? Assume he raised the weight up to a distance of \(2 cm\) each time and that no work is done when the weight is dropped to the floor. (Given: \(1\) food calorie \(=10^{3}\;cal, 1 \;cal =4.186 J\))
